column1: What can you analyze using Application Insights log-based metrics?
column2: The health of your monitored apps.

column1: What can you create using Application Insights log-based metrics?
How are log-based metrics translated into Kusto queries?
column2: Log-based metrics behind the scenes are translated into Kusto queries from stored events.

column1: What type of metrics are stored as pre-aggregated time series?
Why do standard metrics have better performance at query time?
column2: Standard metrics are pre-aggregated during collection, which improves their performance at query time.

column1: What are log-based metrics superior for?
column2: Log-based metrics are the superior option for data analysis and ad-hoc diagnostics due to their higher number of dimensions.

column1: How can you switch between log-based and standard metrics in metrics explorer?
column2: Use the namespace selector to switch between log-based and standard metrics in metrics explorer.

column1: How can developers send events to Application Insights?
column2: Developers can use the SDK to send events manually or rely on the automatic collection of events from auto-instrumentation.

column1: What is the role of Application Insights blades in the Azure portal?
column2: Application Insights blades in the Azure portal act as an analytical and diagnostic tool for visualizing event-based data from logs.

column1: What value does retaining a complete set of events using logs bring?
column2: Retaining a complete set of events using logs brings great analytical and diagnostic value, improving visibility into application health and usage.

column1: What techniques does Application Insights implement to reduce telemetry volume?
column2: Application Insights implements several telemetry volume reduction techniques, such as sampling and filtering.
Pre-aggregated metrics are stored as pre-aggregated time series with key dimensions.

column1: What are the benefits of pre-aggregated metrics at query time?
column2: Pre-aggregated metrics offer faster data retrieval and require less compute power, enabling scenarios such as near real-time alerting and responsive dashboards.

column1: How are pre-aggregated metrics referred to in the Application Insights UX?
column2: In the Application Insights UX, pre-aggregated metrics are called "Standard metrics (preview)."

column1: What SDK versions implement pre-aggregation of metrics during collection?
column2: The newer SDKs (Application Insights 2.7 SDK or later for .NET) implement pre-aggregation of metrics during collection.

column1: What is the advantage of pre-aggregating metrics during collection?
column2: Pre-aggregating metrics during collection reduces data ingestion and lowers cost.

column1: How are pre-aggregated metrics populated for SDKs that don't implement pre-aggregation?
column2: The Application Insights backend populates the pre-aggregated metrics by aggregating the events received through the event collection endpoint.

column1: Does ingestion sampling impact the accuracy of pre-aggregated metrics?
column2: No, ingestion sampling does not impact the accuracy of pre-aggregated metrics.
